frameDefinitions: An Entity ends up in a Final_category, Final_situation, or Final_quality which it was not in before.
A person (the Cognizer) comes to believe something (the Content), sometimes after a process of reasoning.
This frame pertains to noise verbs used to characterize motion.
A State_of_affairs turns out to be true in someone's knowledge of the world.
A Cognizer makes a Decision, which may be about an entity or a course of action.
This frame is concerned with the likelihood of a Hypothetical_event occurring.
frameExamples: Based on the most recent census I have <t>concluded</t> that most Americans sleep too much.
Hybrid grass may <t>prove</t> to be a valuable fuel source.
It is <t>likely</t> that he'll arrive late.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Entity</fen> which undergoes a change, ending up in the <fen>Final_category</fen>, <fen>Final_situation</fen>, or <fen>Final_quality</fen>.
The quality of the <fen>Entity</fen> after the change.
The category that the <fen>Entity</fen> ends up in after the change.
The <fen>Entity</fen>'s situation after the change.
When the change occurs.
Where the change takes place.
Cognizer is the person who comes to believe something.
Words in this frame may occur with a PP headed by <ment>from</ment> which expresses the Evidence on which knowledge or belief is based:
With a target verb, the Content is usually expressed as a finite clausal Complement or an Object NP, and may sometimes be expressed by a PP:

Some verbs in this frame may occur with postverbal Topic expressions: They <t>found out</t> <fex name='Topic'>about us</fex>! More generally verbs in this frame may occur with quantificational nouns followed by Topic expressions:
An act performed by the <fen>Cognizer</fen> which enables them to figure something out.
<fen>Medium</fen> is the text created by the <fen>Cognizer</fen> to communicate that they came to believe a specified <fen>Content</fen>.
The time at which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> discovers the <fen>Content</fen>.
The location at which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> realizes the <fen>Content</fen>.

The <fen>Theme</fen> is the entity that changes location.  In sentences containing a <fen>Cause</fen>, the <fen>Theme</fen> is typically the NP Object.  In other sentences, the <fen>Theme</fen> is normally the External Argument.
The <fen>Source</fen> is any expression which implies a definite starting-point of Motion.
The <fen>Path</fen> is any description of a trajectory of motion which is neither a <fen>Source</fen> nor a <fen>Goal</fen>.
The <fen>Goal</fen> is any expression which tells where the <fen>Theme</fen> ends up as a result of the Motion.
This role identifies the general <fen>Area</fen> in which motion takes place, used particularly if the motion is understood as following a complex or non-linear path.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the motion event takes place.
The <fen>Place</fen> describes the location of a more specific motion (which has <fen>Source</fen>, <fen>Path</fen>, <fen>Goal</fen>, or <fen>Area</fen>).
The state of affairs that a cognizer realizes.
The time at which the <fen>State_of_affairs</fen> is realized.
The <fen>Cognizer</fen> decides on a course of action.
<fen>Decision</fen> identifies the entity or course of action upon which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> decides.
The time or time period over which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> makes the decision.
The place where the <fen>Cognizer</fen> makes the decision.
The state of affairs or occurrence whose likelihood is assessed.
When the event occurs.
Where the event takes place.
listRoleExamples: <fex>I</fex> grow impatient with your insolence.
Everything 's going <fex>wrong</fex>!
He never could understand how she ended up <fex>an evangelist</fex>.
My father got <fex>to where he did in the business</fex> through instinct and entrepreneurialism.
<fex>By 1945</fex> he had become uncertain of the advisability of anyone having such a weapon.
<fex>Sue</fex> realized that Bob was lost.
I have learned <fex>from experience</fex> that poison oak can be painful.
The President learned <fex>that the reporters were hungry</fex>.
The jury learned something terrible <fex>about the suspect</fex>.
<fex>A post-mortem examination</fex> was unable to ascertain the cause of death.
<fex>Back at the tailor's shop</fex>, I deduced that our murderer was not the owner of the kerchief.
<fex>Pat</fex> crunched over the fresh snow.
The train rumbled <fex>out of the station</fex>.
The truck roared <fex>through the tunnel</fex>.
The plates clattered <fex>to the floor</fex>.
The fly buzzed <fex>about the room</fex>.
The train screeched into the station <fex>at half past seven</fex>
<fex>Mo</fex> decided to quit the program.
Mo decided <fex>to quit the program</fex>.
The State Cabinet <fex>today</fex> decided to file an appeal in the Supreme Court seeking an extension of six months for implementation of its judgment
<fex>At the first</fex> crossroad we decided to wait.
<fex>Rain</fex> is fairly unlikely today, I think.
There is a high chance of rain <fex>today</fex>.
There is a high chance of rain <fex>in Seattle</fex>.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: Balkans: A Mirror of the New World Order
The Rise of Nationality in the Balkans
the First and Second World Wars
